Controlling error when testing many hypotheses

In a hypothesis test, we compute some test statistic that is designed to distinguish between a null and alternative hypothesis.  We then compute the probability p(T) of observing a test statistic as large or more extreme as T under the null hypothesis, and reject the null hypothesis if the p-value p(T) is sufficiently small.
